name: Radisson Blu Carlton Hotel, Bratislava

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: Just came back from Bratislava. Had a really lovely time . Stayed at the SAS Raddisson , it was excellent. We had booked a double room and for an extra 30 Euros a night we upgraded to a business class room. It was excellent value as the breakfast was included ( that was usually 18 euros each) and our room had a fantastic balcony, all films were free and the usual bathrobes and slippers.
Breakfast was really good , with every thing you could think of, cooked meats, cerals , fruits, cheese the list goes on.
reviews.title: Could have been better
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The staff were always helpful and even presented my husband with a box of chocolates as we checked out because it was his birthday.
The hotel is very centrally located on Hviezdoslavovo Square, the most prominent square of Bratislava, right across the Opera House.
reviews.title: very affordable luxury
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel's historic building is beautifully renovated on the outside, our Business Class room was, however, concerning its appearence a little sober and cold (we had one of the "contemporary" rooms). Towels, bathrobes, blanket and cushions were not especially fluffy, but a little on the thin side.

reviews.title: Adequate hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is suitable for business travelers - clean and efficient but nothing spectacular. The pillows were lumpy and the beds a bit soft but it was clean. I would not say this is a "destination" hotel. If you need to be in Bratislava then it is fine but I wouldn't make a special trip.
I spent 2 night at the Radisson of Bratislava and I must confess it is the right hotel in the right place. Of course it will improve in the years to come, but has already high european standards.
reviews.title: The right hotel in the right place

reviews.text: We stayed in the hotel several times in November and December 2004. The hotel has a great location; in the center of the old city Bratislava, where most attractions are within walking distance. The hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are clean, spacious and look newly furbished. The bathrooms are also clean and spacious. Our stay was also pleasant because of the helpful staff, whenever we called the housekeeping to ask for something they would get it in impressive speed, the concierge offered to park our rented car in the car-park near by, and the receptionist upgraded our room at our third stay in the hotel. If you decide to stay at the hotel, do not miss their breakfast, it was one of the best we have had in Europe. I'd say the hotel deserves 5 stars. For best rates, book the Radisson SAS web-site at least a week ahead
reviews.title: The Best in The Country

reviews.text: We were offered the chance to upgrade from a cheap internet booking of a standard room without breakfast to a junior suite with some extra amenities and including breakfast for a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Great room under the roof, spectacular view of the central square, opera house, castle etc. The bed was a little soft, otherwise the room was perfect, as was the bar in the lobby, the steam bath in the gym area (together with a reasonably priced and very ompetent massage) and the very generous and well done breakfast in the morning. Enjoyed every minute of our stay, even the momentas we had to work.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: Just stayed three nights at the Radisson SAS and contrary to previous reviews, I found the staff extremely helpful and friendly, the larger than standard rooms maintained in excellent condition and the prices not that expensive for a top class hotel. Little things impressed like the weekly cocktail hour with the management team for canapes and drinks where you can discuss improvements and problems and they were quite disappointed that I didn't have any comments other than very impressed.
reviews.title: adequate but overpriced and nothing special
Excellent location
reviews.text: Apparently, the hotel fell into ruin for 6 years until it was completely rebuilt leaving the historic old facia intact and has now become probably the best hotel in Bratislava. The location couldn't be better, two blocks from the Danube and across the road from the Old Town. The historic centre is tiny, you could walk one end to the other in 5 minutes but it is really cute and there are a few good bars and restaurants there although it isn't overdone like, say, Prague. The Slang pub opposite the hotel does the best ribs I have ever had and all the restaurants are extremely good value. Watch out for the draught beer, it is mostly 10 or 12 per cent!
I was staying here for a conference which was being held at the hotel and this also was very well organised and very successful.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in good location
